page.title: 02THE WOLDS (contd)
page.content: {Prestwold}comprises of 7 estate houses, all dated before 1914, brick built with slate roofs. 1 stone-built, thatched cottage and Prestwold Hall. {Hoton}lies on the edge of the Wolds in an elevated position. Linear shaped, it is mainly residential. 21 houses are pre-1914, 44 built since 1968. It is a conservation area with several listed buildings:brick/timber frame with tile or slate roofs. 1 cottage is thatched. 1 pub, 1 church, 1 village hall, 2 shops/post office. {Wymeswold}10 houses built before 1914-brick & tile roof. 51 built 1914-1960 brick & slate roof (8 have wooden walls). 30 built since 1960-brick & tile. 1 cheese factory, 1 Scout Hut, 2 farm buildings, 1 telephone exchange.
